tone_framing: Frame the tour as a treasure hunt to explore colorful and magical objects from long ago.
key_takeaways: Colors like pink, green, and yellow were special symbols of good luck in Peranakan Chinese culture.
Silk tapestries from China told stories using animals and flowers.
Chinese ceramics, like blue-and-white porcelain, were traded to Southeast Asia as treasures.
creative_activities: Color Discovery: Show the children pictures of ceramics and silk tapestries. Ask them to point out their favorite color and explain how it might symbolize something magical or lucky.

Design Your Own Treasure: Provide paper and crayons, and let the kids draw their own plate or tapestry using bright colors and animal symbols. Encourage them to think about what their design might mean in a story.
Storytelling Circle: Use a porcelain artifact or its image and guide the children to imagine who might have owned it and what kind of adventures it went on during its journey to Southeast Asia.
